title: Nautilus size increase
body:
Riot, can you please increase Nautilus size? Before i can understand having big-ass model be a little distracting, but with the release of Sion, there's no reason not to have Nautilus sized up. I mean its in his damned title "**TITAN** of the depth". Nautilus is one of the, if not the, most iconic tank in the game with the amount of cc he has and how imposing it is to have a Nautilus in the middle of your team, so its only fitting that he gets the size of a true **tank** and **titan**. I mean you guys at Riot already showed us that you understand how big and imposing Nautilus is supposed to feel like ( A New Dawn), so why not put it into play?
http://fc09.deviantart.net/fs71/i/2014/222/c/e/league_of_legends_wallpaper_nr_11__nautilus__by_bluishnyalka-d7ukojw.jpg

Edit: Shout out to increase Maphite size =D
Edit: Rito plz

I for one am of the opinion that a larger hit-box is good for tanks, especially ones that relay on disruption and cc. While in a 1v1 scenario it would be better to be smaller and dodge skill-shots assuming your enemy has any (as targeted abilities go to the center and not the hit-box when deciding range) it is almost always better to have a larger hit-box then your allies when trying to peel or body-block an enemy by standing in their way forcing them to take the time to walk around you. {{champion:31}}  for example is very good at displacing enemies and peeling because of not only hit kit but also his sheer mass. This is also the reason that {{item:2138}} increases size in addition to granting tenacity.

I fully support that large tanks, {{champion:111}} {{champion:54}} get a size increase. They did it for {{champion:82}}, a champion on whom a larger hit-box had no benefit so why not these guys.

Because B: a HUGE hitbox on a SLOW champion is REALLY REALLY BAD.

Rumble's R has a massive hit-box and a fast deployment, meaning it's really easy to land on anybody without blinks or dashes which most tanks have anyway. 

Not to mention Naut can also Q to a wall if your close to a wall or enemy to dodge a lot of slower things anyway. (Morg Q, Nidd Q)
  
By the time Nidd has that kind of build I'd hardly say it's early game 30 kills or not. >-> (You should be tanky enough to deal with anything at that point)

As far as tanks go the ones that need the increase are fairly mobile compared to the likes of Cho'gath or Mundo, who have no mobility.
({{champion:111}} Has Q grab to terrain)
({{champion:54}}  Has Ult and Move-speed steal on Q)
Buy Swiftness or mobi boots, between Iron and masteries you don't need mercs like you used to. Alacrity is even decent now if you don't need home-guard.

Also on the thing of early game. The tanks in question (Naut Malph) Are more often junglers and top laners then support or mids. (not that they can't go there) But a tank has much lower chance of dealing with skill-shots in the jungle, since nobody counter jungles anymore.  Or they go top where they often are against another tank, or somebody that doesn't have skill-shots to begin with. and even early game it's better you take the hit then your adc. 

And one last thing. As a Cho'gath main myself I can easily say that dodging skill-shots is just as easy when I have six stacks as when I have none, or when I play somebody like Soraka. Predicting a skill-shot is 80% of dodging one and anybody can do that regardless of hitbox.
